description.narrative: To support the Recipient’s efforts to enhance its capacity for policy making, regulation, and implementation in the fiscal, social,and financial sectors.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Effectiveness condition | Description :Project Implementation Manual and Financial Management Manual have beenprepared | Due Date :17-Mar-2011
Finance Agreement :Effectiveness condition | Description :Subsidiary Agreement has been executed on behalf of the Recipient and BOM| Due Date :17-Mar-2011
Finance Agreement :Effectiveness condition: Section I.A.1(a) | Description :Project Steering Committee has been established | DueDate :17-Mar-2011
Finance Agreement :Effectiveness condition: Section I.A.1(c) | Description :Technical Working Groups in MoF, MoSWL, and BoM havebeen established | Due Date :17-Mar-2011

title.narrative: The Government shall have submitted to the Parliament for passing the draft laws on accounting and auditing that would create the legal environment for ensuring that Mongolia's accounting and auditing

target.value: Draft laws submitted to the Parliament.

actual.value: Achieved. Draft laws submitted to the Parliament and approved by Parliament in its plenary session held on June 18, 2015. Therevised laws become effective January 1, 2016.

title.narrative: Improve the templates used for financial reporting in accordance with IFRS and create a consolidated database system for allowing electronic filing of financial statements by firms

baseline.value: Existing template ineffective due to modifications to IFRS. Lack of capacity and inefficiency of the current software - eBalance

target.value: Regular financial statement e-filing to MOF through e-balance system

actual.value: Achieved. IFRS-complied accounting guidelines for entities along with the revised chart of accounts obtained approval by theMinister of Finance on December 23, 2014 (order #249). The e-balance system for electronic submission of financial statements wasupgraded and implemented 2013 Q1. Data conversion for years 2002-2012 was done in December 2014. The upgraded e-balance system isnow fully operational with access to past years data to perform analytics.

title.narrative: Capacity enhancement for setting and enforcing international financial reporting standards (IFRS)

baseline.value: Lack of capacity for both regulators and preparers of financial statements with regards to IFRS.

target.value: Enhanced capacity of preparers and regulators of financial reporting e.g. the Accounting Standards Committee

actual.value: Mostly achieved and on track. Efforts to build capacity of the financial statement preparers, Accounting and Auditing StandardsCommittee members and other regulators continue under the project through provision of IFRS and IFRS for SME training. So farapproximately 2750 accounting professionals nationwide have been trained during 100+ training events organized in 2012-2016.Preparation of guidance notes and regulations as well as the improved e-balance system have been also contributing to enhancedcapacity.

title.narrative: Transparency on procurement process managed by the GPA will be enhanced according to the revised Public Procurement Law

baseline.value: Limited disclosure of information on contract awardees, and contract cost.

target.value: Information on bidding and contracts posted on government website

actual.value: Achieved. Information on bidding and contracts posted on Government website. 100% of Procurement Plans, Invitation for Bids &Contract Awards are posted on the procurement website.

title.narrative: MPDSP has prepared a poor households database, on the basis of the Proxy Means Test survey.

actual.value: Achieved. The second round of PMT survey data collection was completed in Dec 2013, and the database became available inApr2014.Furthermore, as of Dec 2014 the database was endorsed by the government to be used across government programs in varioussectors. Use of the database is on slowly expanding within the welfare sector but also for targeting of other government programsand subsidies for the poor.

title.narrative: Fiscal transfer formula for local government financing improved to increase predictability of resources and to reduce horizontal inequities between local governments and facilities

target.value: Government regulations are adopted and implemented to improve the financing mechanisms to local governments.

actual.value: Achieved. The Methodology for Transferring Revenue from the General Local Development Fund to the Local Development Fund approvedby Government resolution #30. The revised version of financing methodology for primary health care services provided by soums andvillages was approved by joint order #498/345 in December 2015 of the Minister of Finance and Ministry of Health and Sport.Variable cost standard normative on preschool and secondary education was approved by Government resolution #242 in 2016, whichincluded average variable cost normative per student at various levels of education.

title.narrative: MoPDSP and GOSWS have created an adequate IT infrastructure for designated users on the basis of the PMT database for poor households and citizens or targeting purposes for social programs, assist

target.value: Multi –sector database is operational, sharing and retrieval of data enabled for all users including a number of Ministries anddepartments using ISDB to determine eligibility of social programs, services and benefits.

actual.value: Achieved. The regulation for ISDB authorized users/ usage and maintenance of integrated household information database is developedand approved by Government Decree # 404 dated 30 Dec, 2014.

title.narrative: Strengthened legal framework for prudent natural resource revenue management.

baseline.value: No legal framework for prudent natural resource revenue management exited.

target.value: New legal framework for prudent natural resource revenue management is adopted and ready for implementation.

actual.value: Achieved. The new law on Mongolia's natural resource fund (Future Heritage Fund Law) was adopted in Dec 2015, ready forimplementation. The MOF initiated work to set up a road map comprising preparatory work necessary to set up a well-functioninglong-term savings fund which is expected to begin accumulation of mineral revenues in 3-4 years.

title.narrative: Strengthened fiscal planning and management capacity through improving budget planning mechanism

baseline.value: No on-line web-based Budget Planning Information System existed for budget preparation and different char of accounts are used forbudget planning (Fiscal, budget planning system) and execution (GFMIS) systems

target.value: The BPIS becomes functional and is used for budget planning both at the central and local government level.

actual.value: Partially achieved and on track. The system is in use for 2017 local budget revision, control, approval, monthly allocation andother local budget planning processes. BPIS end-user manuals have been continuously updated according to the needs of end-users.Interfacing of BPIS with GFMIS (treasury system) and Fiscal (currently used budget preparation system) is under process.

title.narrative: State Bank is restructured and its privatization announced.

baseline.value: State Bank is owned by the Government. No privatization plan is established.

target.value: State Bank is restructured and privatized.

actual.value: Partially achieved and on track. Progress Report on State Bank Privatization was submitted by the MoF to the Parliament EconomicStanding Committee on November 24, 2016. Recommendations and specific directions were issued to the MOF, BOM and State PropertyPolicy and Coordinating Agency to facilitate the privatization. On May 22, a MOU was signed by the BoM, MoF, and State bank ondetailed actions with a goal to complete the privatization by January 2019.

title.narrative: Percentage of staff trained in the Ministry of Population Development and Social Protection, General Office for Social Welfare Service and local governments

baseline.value: unknown due to govt restructuring in 2012

target.value: Training delivered to a significant portion of social workers and GOSWS staff, and long term institutional training capacitybuilding.

actual.value: Achieved. Capacity building of the social welfare staff supported by the MSTAP included the training of 10,274 staff through 161local trainings, overseas study tours, and workshops. In addition, capacity building training on ISDB and WAIS users as well astraining for local staff of care service institutions were conducted. In total, 92.9% of social welfare sector staffs have beentrained.

baseline.value: Institutional framework for risk-based macro-prudential regulation and supervision is not established.

target.value: Formal macro-prudential supervision policy adopted and applied, overall prudential supervision standards upgraded

actual.value: Partially Achieved. Draft regulation and manual of risk based supervision have been developed. Improvement on the regulation andmanual are on-going at Supervision department. The results are planned to be introduced to directors of the Department andmanagement officials of BOM. Also a trial inspection is planned to be conducted based on the draft regulation and the manual beforefinal approval of the draft regulation and manual. Regarding the implementation of Macro-prudential policy, Supervision departmentconducted a research with World Bank consultant and made amendments to the regulation on establishing risk provision fund fornormal loan on assets classifying, provisioning and its allocations.

title.narrative: New deposit insurance agency is fully operational.

baseline.value: New Law on Deposit Insurance Corporation enacted and is about to have its implementation started

target.value: The new Deposit Insurance Corporation is a full-fledged pillar of the financial sector safety net, with proper institutionalstructure and financial capacity, deposit payout capabilities, and clear mandates and responsibilities.

actual.value: Almost achieved and on track to full achievements. The Mongolia Deposit Insurance Corporation (DICOM) was established in 2013 andhas received MNT 250 billion of capital injection. The Bank team completed a Core Principles Assessment of the DICOM in December2016, using the standard developed by the International Association of Deposit Insurers (IADI). Areas of improvements wereidentified. Following the assessment, Action Plan will be developed to enhance DICOM’s operational effectiveness. With the supportof the Bank, the DICOM law is expected to be amended by end-November 2017 to ensure that it is in line with IADI Core Principlesfor Effective Deposit Insurance Systems.

title.narrative: A strategy paper, policy options and main concept driving the pension reform agenda have been submitted to the Government , and animplementation plan has been developed

baseline.value: Despite the govt intention to move to a multitier pension system, the actual strategy has not been defined yet.

target.value: Define pension reform policy concepts to establish sustainable multi-pillar pension system that provides an adequate benefit to theelderly

actual.value: Achieved. Pension reform policy (2015-2030) was approved by the Parliament decree # 53 dated on 11 June 2015. Amendments to keylegislations as the package law on social insurance, Pension law and other relevant regulations have been prepared and are underfurther consultation with various stakeholders.

baseline.value: No IFRS in place for financial sector

target.value: IFRS for banks introduced and applied to Mongolian banks

actual.value: Achieved. IFRS for banks has been introduced and the banks requested to comply with the new accounting standards starting January2016.

title.narrative: By the Closing Date, the Recipient shall have reduced its structural deficit according to the deficit ceilings set forth in the Fiscal Stability Law.

baseline.value: In 2014, the general government budget recorded a deficit equivalent to 4% of GDP, above the FSL's deficit ceiling of 2% of GDP.

target.value: The structural deficit is reduced according to the deficit ceiling of the Fiscal Stability Law.

actual.value: This PDO indicator is considered partially achieved. As the previous ISR noted, the fiscal PDO indicator faced significantchallenges in 2016 due to a sharp increase in the budget deficit in the run-up to the election. The consolidated budget deficitincreased to 17 percent of GDP due to a revenue drop amid the commodity market downswing and an unexpected increase inexpenditures. However, fiscal performance for the first five months in 2017 indicates that fiscal consolidation is now back ontrack and the budget deficit is likely to be significantly reduced according to the revised FSL, due to swift and strong correctiveactions taken by the government. The budget deficit over the first five months has been sharply reduced to 1.5 percent of GDP. Thestrong fiscal performance and signs of economic recovery signals a high likelihood of successfully achieving the annual structuralbudget deficit target of 9.5 percent of GDP in 2017.
